website_summaries.verdict: It costs a bit more, but it also gives you a dual length surface area for far more efficient cooling.
pros: Uses a dual length 240-millimeter radiator, which has two fans and provides a much greater cooling surface
Even with dual fans in the configuration, the system doesn't generate a lot of noise
Uses magnetic installation brackets, which simplifies the process
Compatible with Intel and AMD sockets
cons: Some users report problems with longevity of the pumps

customer_reviews.title: Best cooling unit after 6yrs and still running
customer_reviews.text: I am still running this cool unit after 6 yrs since 2014 and running strong... my CPU i7440k is still between 25c to 30c at the max in idle. 50c at 4.3 mhz light (overclocked)playing BF4, infamous God among us, mortal combat,modern warfare and 55c basically playing all other games, like PUBG, Flight simulator, Wolfenstein, call of duty Battlefield V, battle front Grand theft V, Ace combat
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival.
customer_reviews.text: Item was DOA. After taking my computer apart, installing this cooler, and re-assembling everything, I was excited to see the difference over the stock cooler. I was increadibly pleased to see the cpu idling at 70°c. Given that the stock cooler had been idling at 45°c just a few hours earlier, I decided to contact corsair. After about a half hour of trouble shooting, the rep said it probably has a bad pump. Oh boy. So I got to take the whole thing back apart and re-install everything. I just went to Fry's and bought a Noctua fan. Much better. Idle temp is now at 35°c, full load hits 45.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bavousett

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my fiery i7 very cool.
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is awesome. If you have the space for in in your case, I would recommend this to everyone. We all know stock coolers are crap, and this gives me peace at mind when my CPU is under heavy load. I've never had it go above 70 degrees C with this cooler installed, even with stress tests. As for volume, I put it on the top vents of my case. It's not completely silent, but it's certainly quieter than air cooled systems because it doesn't have to work as hard. My only complaint is that the Corsair Link software is kinda buggy and forgets the LED color I choose upon restart. This is annoying with a color-coded build.
customer_reviews.author: renegadespork

customer_reviews.title: Best cooler on the market
customer_reviews.text: Cools my AMD A10 very well even when at high loads. The grey stock fans are the best for cooling, bought some Corsair Air Series AF120 LED Quiet Edition fans and some Corsair Air Series SP 120 LED Blue High Static fans, which work well but don't put out the air flow the stock grey fans do. Watch the price, I got mine for around $100. Looks like the price has gone up since then. UPDATE: Well my H100i (v1) is finally failing after almost 3 yrs of flawless service cooling several different AMD A series APU's and an Intel Xeon CPU. Just ordered an H100i (v2), we will see if it can preform as well as the V1
customer_reviews.author: Adam Shumann Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Love this Closed loop Cooling system
customer_reviews.text: My first time installing a closed loop cooler. I'm an experienced IT person. The instruction manual is awful; basically useless and in some instances it's incorrect. For instance; the manual states that you don't need to use the backplate with Intel LGA 2011 MB's....WRONG! I needed to use the backplate. I got good advice and instructions on the numerous YouTube instructional videos. I had also purchased the Thermaltake CLW0216 and NZXT X312 Cooling Systems. The NZXT didn't fit the CPU properly and the Thermoltake was just too difficult to install. This Corsair was REALLY easy to install. The power connections are simple and straightforward. I HIGHLY recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: rob damiani

customer_reviews.title: Cools my CPU, LEDs don't work after two weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my CPU cool indeed, but the yellow LED inside the CPU cover portion burned out/stopped working within a few weeks so I only have red/blue (and it doesn't even fade to purple, just from red to blue, also it can't do white). I have reverted Corsair Link to previous versions, updated to the latest version whenever there was one, messed with the settings including the common tip of setting the "0" value in the color sliders (255/255/255) to "1" instead of "0" and still haven't gotten them to work (I even tried 6, 10, etc, but nothing). Pretty disappointed to not have this feature work but hey, at least my CPU isn't overheating.
customer_reviews.author: Dave G

customer_reviews.title: Was at 43c stock idle. Now at 9c idle. Plenty of room for overclocking.
customer_reviews.text: Stock I was at 43c idle. Installed an Evo 212 air cooler. Idle temp went down to 35c Instaleld this Corsair H100i and I'm now at 9c. Any colder and I'll nearly freeze my chip. Started to overclock my chip. Got another 1Ghz out of it. Now I'm at 20c idle. This thing will give you plenty overhead if you're looking to overclock a chip. But my problem soon became the motherboard heat from the north-bridge and ram trying to keep up (I assume). Because with each overclock the other temps would rise much higher. So it's not just about your chip's heat. So the only down side is that this doesn't cool the whole board. lol
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: it can only cool THAT much
customer_reviews.text: I didnt expect this to be so BIG, coming from a H60... WOW! Be sure you have room in your chassis for this! Also, if you DONT have alot of case fans, etc, this will be loud for you. I will admit, there is NO difference in benefit between this and the H60... it can only cool THAT much. As with all these products, your AMBIENT air is the most important factor in terms of cooling potential. However, the ability to toggle options via the Corsair LINK interface is really good. You can set up different options, from maximum blow to perfomance mode, to quiet...
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Khan

customer_reviews.title: 5 years in and still running as if it was new
customer_reviews.text: I've been running this on a Core i7 for the past 5 years and it is cooling like the day I bought it. I've gone through 3 other (non-Corsair) coolers on a different processor while this one keeps purring along. I know this product is pretty old (in technology terms) and there are newer versions but I'm really impressed with Corsair's quality. I wouldn't hesitate to buy a new liquid cooler from them today. I just wish Corsair made a full coverage cooler for an AMD Threadripper.
customer_reviews.author: Slippery Pete

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and works well
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this cooler in the computer that I'm using to enter this review. The cooler was easy to install and has worked for the past six months without issue. I don't make heavy use of the computer so the cooling unit just loafs along. It makes about zero noise from what I can tell. The processor is a I7-4790K running at up to 4.5GHz, but usually it's at minimum speed. I don't use the Corsair software to control the unit since I hate to load extra software on my computer. The ASUS motherboard I use does a good job of controlling the fans on the radiator portion of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff SwitzerTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this cooler for several months and really like it. I have never had such a cool running machine. Installation was more difficult than I would have liked, but it was probably more an issue with my case, not the cooler. There was not enough clearance to easily mount the cooler and I was using a full sized, modern case. I was able to get it mounted a bit off center for my cutouts, and it is working fine. I do not overclock, but still I like that the fans run quiet and the case is cool. I think I would use this in most of my future builds. This was my first water cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Grenik

customer_reviews.title: Huge, powerful, and beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge! Fortunately I had room in the HAF X tower to mount it, but wow! I also replaced the stock fans with the Cougar Vortex PWM 120 Cooling CF-V12HPB. I actually didn't even try the stock fans, just went straight to the Cougars. It's a match made in heaven. So quiet, SO much cooling power, and has some pretty serious WOW factor in it. The Corsair logo lights up a nice white glow, which is just hot. Mounting was super easy. It comes with its own thermal paste built in, but I got some aftermarket stuff (Antec Nano Diamond Thermal Compound Formula 7) and it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Joel and Amber

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: easy to install, work great. I would give it 5 stars but the fans are crappy and kind of loud. I'll be switching them out soon. Intel Core i7-4770K (OC'd to 4.5Ghz, 1.20v) Asus Sabertooth Z87 EVGA GeForce GTX780 SuperClocked w/EVGA ACX Cooler (Plan on SLI when price drops) Crucial Ballistix Sport 16GB (8GBx2) DDR3 1600 MT/s (PC3-12800) CL9 @1.5V NZXT Phantom 410 (140mm front intake, 120mm side intake, 120mm back exhaust) Corsair H100i (2x 120mm fans on top as an exhaust) Cooler Master Silent Pro Gold 1000W 80 PLUS Gold Samsung 840 Pro Series 128GB SATA 6Gbps SSD (Windows) Seagate Baracuda 1TB 7200RPM HDD (Games/Storage) Crappy DVD Burner
customer_reviews.author: GN

customer_reviews.title: wished i would have bought it sooner
customer_reviews.text: So, this thing is awesome!!! keeps my 8350 and my old 1055t at 35 idle and 28 idle respectively ! overclocked 8350 to 4.33 with asus auto tuning. never runs hot. READ: So, nobody tells you that the central unit has lights that show blue when cold, Green when normal temperature and RED when running hot.!!! I love that!! Also, instructions are easy HOWEVER they dont tell you to remove the female cover that comes with the L (Y) cable!!! it took me an hour to figure it out!!! when it is so easy./..baaaaad lack of instruction!! after that installing is a breeze/ buy this. you can control the fan speed to be quiet when you are not gaming
customer_reviews.author: underwood

customer_reviews.title: but I definitely feel like this has made a difference in my temps
customer_reviews.text: This can be a pain in the ass to set up properly, but I definitely feel like this has made a difference in my temps. Also, note that the hoses DO NOT bend very easily. When I transplanted my rig into a mini-ATX case (BitFenix Prodigy), I had to give up my optical drive (okay, okay, maybe no one reeeeeally needs an optical drive in this day and age..) because the hoses wouldn't give enough for me to slide the drive in. Transplant, by the way, went fine. Pair this with some Arctic Silver paste and baby, your core temps aren't stewin!
customer_reviews.author: tess

customer_reviews.title: Leaky Loop
customer_reviews.text: I have an H80 in my current desktop and wanted to go with the same cooling solution for a small server I was building. The package arrived on time, but the Closed Loop Liquid cooling had come apart and the cooling liquid was everywhere inside the box. I returned and replaced the item and it had the same problem. Just be warned that this is a possibility when ordering closed loop cooling solutions. I ended up going to another retailer and buying the same part because it was quicker to replace if the item was broken again. Overall I do like the item when it comes in one piece.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit on a MSI ATX DDR3 2600 LGA 1150 Motherboards Z97 GAMING 5 Motherboard
customer_reviews.text: I must be a moron. I was under the impression that every right minded person builds their mounting brackets for all ATX style boards. And yet here I am using the mount from another heatsink to attach this thing to my mobo. Why? It won't fit otherwise. Every angle I can fathom to turn that underside bracket it never lines up with the holes. Darn shame because it does appear to be a nice product. But their mountin g solution is proper screwed. It doesn't work with the (currently) most popular motherboard on Amazon. If you need the one that fits 1150 mobos the H110 is what you want apparently.
customer_reviews.author: Oafkad

customer_reviews.title: Using Windows 8? Read this first...
customer_reviews.text: So if you are using Windows 8 BE CAREFUL when updating the firmware. I personally would not recommend doing it. This is NOT compatible necessarily with Windows 8. There are registry edits I had to make to as described here to get it to be recognized:  There are COUNTLESS reports of these being bricked when people try upgrading the firmware on Windows 8. It will become an RMA request at that point. I would recommend updating the firmware using Windows 7 if you find you need to upgrade it. You have been warned. That being said, it works really good at its main job cooling the CPU so 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Very good prefilled watercooling. (Fans are loud but was replaced, elsewise good)
customer_reviews.text: I am weary of pre-filled water coolers but I figured I would take a change with the Corsair Hydro Series H100i, It with 2 Corsair Air Series SP120 Quiet Edition fans, and 2 Corsair Air Series AF120 Quiet Edition Fans on 2x Push, 2x Pull config runs my 3570K at aprox 22-28C on Idle, and 53-55C on 4.4Ghz Overclock on full load. Not sure on the temperatures of the stock fans, but they was somewhat good as far as i remember, but were quite loud so i wanted to replace them. Really good temperatures, but I've only had it for 2 Months and I'm not sure on the lifespan of these, but so far Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Fields

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back in 2014, this thing is still working fine and keeps my CPU cool. Heard about longevity issues with these, but I haven't had any issues. I highly recommend this Cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, never expected the pump to fail before either of the fans.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing that it did not last much longer than the warranty. Purchased Aug-2013 and died Feb-2016, so roughly 30 months, so the cost is about $5 a month. In November I purchased 2 more of this same model for a couple more machines I built. So now I'm wondering about that decision, only time will tell. I just purchased the H100i v2 cause it appears this model has been discontinued. Well see if they made any improvements to the quality of the water pump. I honestly expected the fans to quit first, I never suspected the pump would fail first. Well, there are now extra fans if that happens on the rest of them.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Frankland

customer_reviews.title: I just installed these today and so far so good. I had the CM Seidon and the pump ...
customer_reviews.text: I just installed these today and so far so good. I had the CM Seidon and the pump failed on me and my computer kept overheating. My computer kept going up to 90 Celsius, it was ridiculous. Now, sitting at idle, my computer is at 30 Celsius. The only complain I have is that the fans are EXTREMELY loud. I saw a lot of reviews for this product and noticed the one thing that everyone agreed on was how loud the fans were. I thought, "They are probably just being nitpicky, I can get past it." I can get past it, but holy crap these things are truly LOUD.
customer_reviews.author: Boyetti

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler
customer_reviews.text: I'm running a Haswell 4790 in a gaming rig and it was running a bit hot for my comfort level. Bought this, it was fairly easy to install, and now my rig is running at minimum 10 c lower than it was under heavy graphics load. For reference, I'm running BF4, H1Z1, Rift, GW2, SWTOR, and several other games - most at full rez (except BF4, I go for FPS on that game) Using a HAF 932 case and had to loosen the motherboard screws a tad to get the back bracket on, but was able to tighten them back once the bracket was in place. Numbers on HWMonitor make me happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Lucero

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler, fans are "meh"
customer_reviews.text: Pros- It keeps my OCed i5 2500k cooler then the Hyper 212 I had on there before. Easy install on my Phantom 410 case Cons- The fans are very loud at max RPM. If you're not OCing that much you can keep them on low RPM but they then make a "wub wub wub" sound that I found very annoying. I replaced the fans with a pair of Noctua F-12s and it's night and day. Paired with those this is a great budget cooler setup. Also the Corsair Link software can be rather unstable. I've had to re-install a few times. Not really a issue with the cooler though.
customer_reviews.author: JRLloyd

customer_reviews.title: Great liquid CPU cooler!
customer_reviews.text: This cooler from Corsair comes with all the hardware you need to mount it. The water block lights up with different colors if you download the Corsair Link software free from Corsair. The cooler feels very sturdy. The only problem I have, and other reviewers have stated, is the fans supplied with it leave something to be desired. They have a buzz sound, even with the Quiet profile in the Corsair Link software. You may want to consider replacing these fans with a better set from Corsair. Otherwise, get this cooler. The pump is really quiet. Highly recommended, if you want to do overclocking.
customer_reviews.author: Lance D. Ripplinger

customer_reviews.title: Great cooling, but more to this than it allows you to use
customer_reviews.text: I love the liquid cooling, and the light up front so you know that it is powered and working. However, the build in USB was unexpected, so it cost me a USB port on the MB. This however was also to power the two fans....in theory. The fans came with a different connector and could not be plugged into the head piece, and instead needed to connect to the MB in the CPU slots. It still works beautifully, but it looks like there are more abilities for this device that are not included with the model I purchased. The CPU has yet to cross 37C, so it does it's job well.
customer_reviews.author: L. McNerneyTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: works well and kept my cpu nice and cool even during overclocking my Intel i5 4670k ...
customer_reviews.text: works well and kept my cpu nice and cool even during overclocking my Intel i5 4670k at its highest recommended clock speed. Very nice for those who has no water cool knowledge and want water-cooled system or even those who can't afford or don't want the hassle of setting a custom water-cool system. It's quiet enough and doesn't bother me at all. for those who is interested in this product and is new to water-cooling make sure your tower/case has space to mount the radiator preferably somewhere close like the top or back and it at least can hold a dual length 240mm radiator/fan. I use a Corsair Vengence c70 which works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Cho Yang

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Improvement
customer_reviews.text: I do some video editing, which always hits the CPU hard during the conversion process -- usually sending all cores to a solid 90-100% for the duration of the conversion, which can be 20+ minutes. My Intel i7 with the default heatskink+fan would almost hit 100 degrees C in these conditions with no overclocking. Well, I switched to this H100i, overclocked from 2.8 GHz to 3.66 GHz and it stays under 75C going full blast (and finishes noticeably faster). It amazes me that I can seriously overclock and run cooler than it used to run while NOT overclocked. I think this liquid cooler + overclocking may be the single best overall performance increase you can get for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Pecos Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooler, Love Corsair
customer_reviews.text: I love this cooler, I was worried about having liquid in my computer but everything has been great. It is a bit bulky so just be aware for small cases. I have used this for only a month and one year. No issues in cooling and I really like the Cosair logo that lights up. Which by the way you can set to whatever color you want using RGB sliders and make it cycle through colors if you wanted. It can also change color based on the temperature of your processor. I would definitely buy this again, though probably a newer model ;) I love Corsair, all the things I can get by Corsair I get.
customer_reviews.author: David Barreto

customer_reviews.title: works good.
customer_reviews.text: It does what I need it to do...but not amazingly well. It keeps my 4790k at idle in the mid to high 20's...under extremem load though (IE: Prime 95), it can still get into the upper 70's. I can live with that...but the software causes all kinds of problems with my HTPC server. I finally uninstalled it, and all the problems went away (crashing, and slow network buffering - including plex and JRiver MC20)...the only real reason I needed the software though was to change the LED color, and that setting sticks even without the software.
customer_reviews.author: SW

customer_reviews.title: It does its job very well
customer_reviews.text: I recently dished out a lot of money on a desktop, and I wanted to see how well it could perform. Even when running a game like Skyrim on ultra-high with over 10 different mods the unit remains very cool. I'd read some reviews of this and there were complaints about the noise, but in my experience (maybe I need to add more mods to try working it harder?) I never even notice it's running. I'm sure its there, but with my roommates' pc's and the noise from all the games going I cannot hear this unit at all. Didn't give it 5 stars because I reserve the 5th for durability and I've only had the product for 3 weeks
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Andross

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and set up. Keeps my cpu temps low. It's extremely loud when it starts up but quiets down after the rpm is lowered, which I did through the BIOS. The LINK software didn't work properly; I could see the temps but couldnt control the fan speeds. Customer response is quick. FYI: These self-contained systems can leak so keep an eye on it. I had to buy this because my previous cpu cooler sprung a slow leak and spilled over my motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: found this item is just the best out there I have many build under my belt ...
customer_reviews.text: found this item is just the best out there I have many build under my belt all with the corsair liquid 60 series an up to the 100i not one failed in FACT I HAvE NEVER TRIED ANY OTHER LIQUID COOLER, I SEE NO NEED TO THE VERS AND YOU OTHER USER THAT HAVE PUT ANY OF THE OTHER AGAINST THE CORSAIR COOLER JUST NOT ABEL TO BEAT THIS BRAND OF COOLER IF I AM WRONG FEEL FREE TO LETME KNOW,, IF NOT I STAND CORRECTED ON THAT STATEMENT .. BIG SHOUT OUT TO THE GAMERS OUT THERE!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Calvin 45

customer_reviews.title: H80i is a great product
customer_reviews.text: I own both a h100i and a h80i. There isn't that much of a difference in performance or capability. The only issue with the h80i is the size of it. You would have a lot of trouble in some midtower cases because it uses 2 fans on each side. The system I added into is quite difficult, I have to dismantle it to plug in the fan connector and the 8 pin on the top of the motherboard. The fans on it are okay, but I'd rather just find some better ones. Such as the Noctua NF-F12, but it isn't a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Mins

customer_reviews.title: It's awesome!
customer_reviews.text: As a gamer, I love this! It keeps my CPU temperature extremely manageable and as of now, my CPU is standing at 37 degrees Celsius. On some demanding games, it only goes up to around 60 degrees Celcius and that's pushing the game it ultra details. For some gamers, it might be a problem if they dislike loud fans. This thing is a powerhouse and it WILL be loud if you like to push your games to max detail quality. As for myself, I really do not mind the sound so it's not such a downside for me. Overall, I'm happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: KrimsonLeaf

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Have my AMD 965 BE overclocked to 3.8Ghz at 1.36v and doesn't go above 34c(93f) on max load. Going to get it up to 4.2. Worth the cost if your planning on overclocking. Only thing is if you are using AMD and don't have a stock mounting bracket you will need to buy one since this doesn't come with an aftermarket back-plate. I was using a Hyper 212 evo before this so I didn't have the stock bracket on my mother board anymore. Posted a link for the stock AMD retention bracket I purchased, worked as it should and made out of good and strong materials.
customer_reviews.author: JASON P

customer_reviews.title: and Corsair made it amazing! It's a great
customer_reviews.text: This was my first foray into water cooling, and Corsair made it amazing! It's a great, effective product and it was easy to install. When I first heard of water cooling, all the way up until I had this in my hands, I was nervous. They sound like such a horrible match. To be more accurate, "liquid". This is super quiet all the time, and my PC powers through even when playing CPU-intensive games where I know from experience my old fans were screaming into the heatsink. With this product, it's like the cooler is saying "Chill bro, I got this".
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: CorsairLINK fails with two processor system
customer_reviews.text: I installed a pair of H80i in my 2 x Xeon E5-2650 system. CorsairLINK2 shows temperature and usage percentage for both processors, but it shows pump, fan an led controls only for H80i kit 1. Average temperature processors in idle state was about 38° C. I updated the firmware to 1.0.5 (released in February 2013) and reinstalled CorsairLINK2 software to tray to solve the problem about displaying the controls for the second H80i kit. These are the results: 1. The average temperature in idle time is now 40° C. 2. Fan noise also increased 3. CorsairLINK2 software still shows fan, led and pump controls for only H80i kit 1. No control of kit 2.
customer_reviews.author: uvr

customer_reviews.title: Extreme Performance = Extreme Satisfaction
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with this product. It runs cool, very cool. Mine hovers around 25-28C surfing the web at stock with the 4790K. Each fans connected are controllable so you can adjust it to your liking. Some might say that the fans are loud but you can adjust them and the temps don't actually change much. There is also an LED that have an adjustable color scheme. As a cosmetic piece, this looks 10x better than any air cooler. At $90, this is worth the luxury purchase for your rig. I will OC the CPU and update this review is necessary. So far nothing to say but good things about the 100i. Installation was also a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Rockman

customer_reviews.title: Works Well, but a little Noisy
customer_reviews.text: The cooler works well. I have it currently set up with the stock fans and its a little bit noisy when running under high loads. Normal gaming and processes it works fine without to much frustration but benchmarking pushes it a bit. It maintains low temps on my CPU very well (i7-4820K @ 4.3 ghz) temps are around 56-61C under 100% load. If you can handle the extra temp increase you can slow down the fans to medium and get around 68-73C to minimize some noise. I would recommend this CPU cooler, but maybe order some new fans with it, Cougar fans would make good alternates.
customer_reviews.author: Cody B Harney

customer_reviews.title: Simple installation, good quality
customer_reviews.text: I had what I thought was a good quality water cooling system. Until it stopped working after just 13 months - of course it had a 12 month warranty. So I looked around, checked reviews and feedback, and decided on this as a replacement. Installation was quick, the thermal compound is included, and all I needed was a screwdriver. As a bonus, the logo lights up so you know that it's on. It's so quiet most times, you need that. When the system is working overtime and has a big CPU load, the fans kick up in speed - and it does get louder - not annoyingly so, but it can be heard. Usually it's nearly silent.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Drew

customer_reviews.title: Have had this thing running for 5 years now
customer_reviews.text: Still does its job! Got it because I was told that the 4770K runs pretty hot, well this thing keeps it at 34C idle and it never goes above 40C. Would recommend this or a newer version!
customer_reviews.author: Jared Lerman

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Cooler HOWEVER -
customer_reviews.text: The product quality is impeccable as expected from Corsair. HOWEVER: and this is the most important thing, ensure your case is built for this before you buy it. The case should have an opening in the top for 2 fans. The opening will be 12" long by 6" wide. I purchased the Antec P100 from Amazon and this cooler together. The antec case is incredible If your case if not built for this, you will be returning it. If it isnt, buy the H80i model which is a single fan unit and can be bolted onto the rear of the case.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Did not work correctly
customer_reviews.text: I tried this cooler, but for some reason, when I first started using it, the temps were at 24 C, but they only went up to 27 C under load. However, all at once, for some reason my temps went up to 30 C and 38 C under load. I returned the item as I did not trust the increase it temps that were not explained, and wondered about the pump or perhaps a small leak. I returned it, and when I put the stock heat sink and fan for the i7-4750K, the temperatures were pretty much the same as the Corsair H100i.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: It's the PUMP.  It's always the PUMP.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this a couple of weeks & all was great until the pump got flaky. Powering up my computer this Monday morning I noticed all five fans go to maximum (they are normally very quiet) The pump head is flashing red and the pump temp is 50C and pump RPM is around 200 and bouncing around. Let it sit 15min and retry. Eventually it starts and is stable all day. This is my morning, every morning now. I am going to switch to simple heat-pipe & fan config while this goes back. Can't be without a computer. : )
customer_reviews.author: B Reid

customer_reviews.title: Good cooling performance
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an unused H80i from a friend and it was DOA, making terrible grinding sounds. Given I didn't find a better alternative I went with the new one from Amazon. On start up it sounds like a jet engine and continues to be very loud. It wasn't hugely obvious, but you must install the Corsair software. With that the startup is loud, but it quickly quiets down. Install the software and you are good to go. Just be aware you must have access to the rear of the board to install the bracket to support the block on the CPU. Otherwise performance is good.
customer_reviews.author: awraynor

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the trouble
customer_reviews.text: I installed this thinking it was going to be quieter than my stock CPU fan. My stock CPU fan gets pretty loud when running higher end games. Boy was I wrong. The fans on this thing are like tiny jet engines. They rarely ever cycle down. They sound like they are going full bore even when just surfing the web. I even installed their software and it didn't work. I would really only recommend this if you are way overclocking and running really hot. Otherwise completely not worth the labor to install or the huge amount of noise they produce.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Graves

customer_reviews.title: Excellent CPU cooler.
customer_reviews.text: Best CPU cooler I've ever owned. I should knock it down a star because I had to buy some rubber washers to take up the slack when installing to the MB, but because I researched it heavily before buying I knew it was going to happen. I found it pretty easy to install and it is performing as advertised and admirably at that. I would recommend this to anyone thinking of buying an after-market cooler for any reason. You get professional results from an easy to install, low maintenance product. It is difficult to connect the cords to the cooling head once it's installed, I had to use a dental mirror to assist me.
customer_reviews.author: Dinsdale

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until failure
customer_reviews.text: The unit seemed to perform very well for a little over a month before failing. While working on my computer the fans suddenly went to full rpm and the light on the pump which was blue suddenly began to pulsate red, a quick check of the CPU temperature showed it exceeding 80 degrees and climbing. I shut off the computer and let it cool for several hours then turned it on with the same results. I tried contacting their technical support with no luck. I removed the unit and replaced it with the fan that came with the CPU and it seems to be working well. Thankfully I don't think the CPU was damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Pump noise killed this product for me.
customer_reviews.text: This product cools just fine, great even. I had to uninstall it from my case because the cooler races and stops dynamically with the CPU temperatures. I believe it is the pump that did this but it was so annoying to me (even while wearing a Steel Series Siberia v2 headset) that I had to uninstall. It kept my temperatures very low but I would not purchase it again based on noise. To me it was very irritating. Literally as my CPU usage (4770K) would vary slightly the cooler would vary it's performance as well.
customer_reviews.author: NotChineseNotHiredByCompany

customer_reviews.title: Really Heavy, hard to fit and huge, but cooling is perfect
customer_reviews.text: Why Buy it? * Keeps your peocessor low temp even on overclock * Is universal for different sockets type * Is relatively easy to attach to the motherboard Why not? * Huge. I moved my fans outside the box, to fit this thing in * Tubes are absolutely hard to bend. Provides less flexibility on installation. * The software tool that comes with it is a piece of trash One more thing: People say it's really noisy, when fans are working 40%+ power. I did a stress test with 100% CPU load, it kept it in 50C and never got more than 40% in power. So I never here the noise apart from BIOS tests.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Hydro worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Nice series from Corsair. The upgraded installation is so much better than what they use to have in the past. I had an old gen 1 series and the brackets and screws were a pain. This setup is easy to install. Read the directions and installation will be fine. I've noticed a few degrees difference. Nothing dramatic in change. The reason I purchased this is my old one finally died. Personally I stayed away from all the software installation. That's up to you. I prefer to keep bloat of my computer.
customer_reviews.author: ScottB

customer_reviews.title: Item sent was V2
customer_reviews.text: I received H80i V2. It is not mentioned anywhere in the description and will not work in my case because the radiator is thicker.
customer_reviews.author: Foosking

customer_reviews.title: LEGIT!
customer_reviews.text: I will get right to the point.....EASY install(if you go to You Tube).......instructions are not DETAILED....but will get you through.the software needed is NOT included...(go to Corsair web site).If you are using a ASUS Sabertooth...REMOVE the mother board for Easy install.You can thank me later....Now I Have The C70 case.(it was Made for this case! so my install may hve been Easier than yours) temps droped 10 degrees after heat cycling the thermal paste.removed one star for instructions(go to YOU tube!)
customer_reviews.author: Don_Key_Sho

customer_reviews.title: I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.text: I saw a nice decline in core temperature when this puppy was installed. The only reason I didn't get it five stars was because my Radiator had a few dents and bends in the metal and already had dust accumulated in it. Also, the stand offs were covered in an oily substance that was sticky. Which was strange because it looked like it had never been opened. After cleaning off all the parts that came with the unit, everything functioned appropriately.
customer_reviews.author: Stefano

customer_reviews.title: Too large for a Mid ATX case
customer_reviews.text: While this product works well, and keeps my computer over 10*C cooler at 100%, and over 20*C during regular use, it's a huge pain to install, what with it's unpictured radiator and second cooling fan, and the cables that move the liquid coolant back and forth are incredibly inflexible making it difficult to neatly place everything in a mid case. I'm also not a fan of the fact that the radiator extends so far down into the case that it makes contact with, and ever so slightly bends, my video card. I have a gtx560 ti twin frozr, for those wondering about size.
customer_reviews.author: GuardLK

customer_reviews.title: ... gave it 3 stars is the software (corsair link) sucks.. but the actual pump and radiator is ...
customer_reviews.text: the only reason i gave it 3 stars is the software (corsair link) sucks.. but the actual pump and radiator is great. i had a couple fins bent when i got it but it wasn't to bad. the fans cover it up. these stock fans arnt to bad if your saving money but i switched them out for the sp120 led and i am much happier. other than that its a great product. im running amd fx8320 overclocked to 4.4 ghz and it runs idle 27C and on load around 47C.
customer_reviews.author: austin ireland

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: This was my first liquid CPU cooler, and I got it installed in my Corsair 760T case without any issues. Didn't have to mess with the liquid or anything, just had to determine how I wanted the fans to function, get them screwed in and attach all the connectors. Keeps my i7-4790K in the 30's in idle, and upper 50's under heavy load. The led behind the Corsair logo can be adjusted via their software, as well as the fan speeds. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Savpreet P.

customer_reviews.title: It does what it says.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I went from an H60 to this and I saw a drop in temps immediately. The drop was about 20c's in gaming and 10c in idle. Worth every penny if you have a custom build. All those magazine pictures of gaming rigs can't be wrong. It's no wonder this is a popular cooler. It does what it says. Keeps you cool. By the way. The color pattern off the logo is awesome, I had no idea that you could change the color of the logo. Goes great with my case.
customer_reviews.author: Guzman

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well
customer_reviews.text: First off make sure you check what socket/mobo this can fit. I did not so when I first received this product I was a bit upset, but this was my fault and not the sellers because I didn't check. After some slight modifications to the stock mounting bracket I finally got the unit to install and it powered up just fine. I have yet to receive once of the many cpu overheating errors i use to which is what spurred me into buying one of these products. overall I am quite pleased with this unit thus far; powered up just fine, runs relatively quiet and keeps my cpu cool which are all the things i needed from this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Terrance

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but I ran into problems with the stock ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but I ran into problems with the stock thermal paste not doing it's job. I was having cpu heat issues and ended up pulling this off. The paste stayed in it's original form on the cooling block. I think it may have been dried out/old. I scraped it off and replaced it, problem gone and the cooler has been working great since. Had problems with Win10 support for the Corsair Link software, but that has since been resolved with a software update.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Best AIO cooler for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Have this hooked up to my i7-4790K  and keeps it cool with nice overclocks. I upgraded the fans to a pair of Noctua NF-F12's  which was a worthwhile upgrade. The Noctua fans are a much quieter and efficient. Overall, the H100i is a great all-in-one cooler if you need to cool your CPU. Easy to install with great software support. I also like the red lighting (you can pick your own color via Corsair Link software). BYOGamingPC.com
customer_reviews.author: BYOGamingPCcom

customer_reviews.title: wooo this is nice
customer_reviews.text: the upgraded fans, wider tubes, and usb controlled management make this far superior to the h100 i tried with push/pull but the difference was not noticeable. (i do not have it overclocked) i ended up using the 2 extra fans to improve airflow across the 2 raid 10 setups i have in my case. this has a very easy install and came pre-greased. i did wipe the grease off and used arcticsilver5, but that is just me. i am sure their paste was just as good. old habits dont die
customer_reviews.author: eph

customer_reviews.title: Awesome CPU cooler
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic CPU cooler - I use it on my AMD FX 8 core CPU which stock requires a water cooler and this fits the bill perfectly. It keeps the CPU nice and cool allowing me to transcode/render full HD videos maxing out the CPU 100% for hours or game all day long without a single hitch. Must buy, only make sure your case allows for top mounded 2x120mm fans as it is a sealed system that stays in the case. The software that actually controls the unit's speeds and LED color needs some work but it by no means hinders the operation of the cooler.
customer_reviews.author: ~ Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Buy it if you have room.
customer_reviews.text: On a corsair 750D - Bigger than I expected. Mounted where my rear exhaust fan would be, pulling cool air from outside the case to the inside, I had to mount the push fan on the outside of the case because that extra half inch put too much torque on the water pipes and I dont want to get water on my stuff, cuz, reasons. The cpu block is mounted sideways leftways. Keeps 4690k at 34c max, idle is 22-25 depending on what is running at idle.
customer_reviews.author: Jakeman249

customer_reviews.title: Almost 2 years still good
customer_reviews.text: You can run games on quiet mode with a decent CPU without worrying about the temperature or the fans noise that makes it feels like a jet on max settings (So far you won't use this setting)
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: No Hassle, Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Nothing force-fitted or sharp-edged about the install. Hardly more work than installing a CPU. I was a little alarmed when I saw the short screws used to mount the radiator on the case bent some fins, even when used with the included washers, but the damage was very minimal and wont affect cooling at all. I bought this product not for overclocking, but as an attempt to reduce noise levels in my gaming builds - money well spent. There is a noticeable reduction in my jaw tension related to long-duration low-level noise aggravation. The software is a little clunky, but nothing that can't be adjusted to.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: Corsair Link is no good, Green LED died
customer_reviews.text: LED dying was covered under the warranty, but I didn't want to go without my computer for weeks. (Mine is blue now, so it fits) I like it though, as far as I can tell it is good hardware. Keeps everything cool. The software sucks! Install it, change colors, uninstall. One of the reasons I went for this one is that it was supposed to show me all the temps from my gear. But it has consistently disappointed me.
customer_reviews.author: Harold

customer_reviews.title: Yay!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome AIO cooler! I used to have 212+ installed and it was hitting around 66-70c on load depending on ambient temperature. When I installed H100i, my core temperature was only 51c at 100% load! ( Prime 95 ). The only thing I didn't like about the cooler is the radiator fin - it bent rather easily. Mobo: Asus Sabertooth Z77 CPU: Intel Core i5 2500K CPU Cooler: Corsair H100i GPU: EVGA GeForce GTX 670 FTW SLI RAM: 16GB Kingston HyperX Genesis Sound Card: Asus Xonar Essence STX HD 1: 120GB Intel 520 SSD HD 2: 1TB Western Digital Black PSU: 750W Silencer MK III
customer_reviews.author: K. Paik

customer_reviews.title: Great liquid cooling
customer_reviews.text: I love liquid cooling as it makes the computer look sick and also easy to manage (barely). Keep the computer cool and as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: These items you will see were for my son to build his own gaming PC. He loves all of it! He was the one who chose all the parts and is very satisfied with his purchase. Other than that I can't tell you anymore because I do not use his PC. I do know that he really really likes building and choosing what goes into his desktop. He uses this for gaming purposes and says the speed is amazing! He does want to add more, not sure of what, wish I could tell you more.
customer_reviews.author: Sally59

customer_reviews.title: Docs are no help, had to research best way to install it
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but took some time to determine the best way to install it with only 2 hands. Also, very little instructions on how to install it. For instance, there are small arrows on the fans that come with this which show which direction the fan blows, but no documentation says that anywhere. Also, it is a bit of a juggling act to install 2 fans and the heat sink onto the back of the PC case without dropping everything. It will take some practice, but you will figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Thomas

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I must say, I was planning on doing a custom water loop in my build but a friend showed me this bad boy and wow. I am amazed. This cooler has been in my build for a few months now and I am very impressed. The only thing I have trouble with is programming the LEDs to do what I want it to on the pump. It pisses me off but hey, not a big deal. I am very pleased with the cooler. Definitely would recommend to someone looking for a taste in water cooling. It is so worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle VanOrman

customer_reviews.title: Work good while they last, then then the pumps fail.  Wont buy any more.
customer_reviews.text: These work great while they last. This is the second one I have purchased. But they both suffered the same fate. The pumps fail after a 2 or 3 years of service. The one I bought in August of 2014 just failed. Going to replace it with an air cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but need some quality improvement
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Quiet and Keeps the motherboard, cpu and the entire system cool. -Easy and simple to install (watch out for the Y-Connector port area, very poor built quality) -Keeps my Alienware Area 51 system cool all the way. Con: -The only con I can think of is the USB header and Y-connector area---pretty much the entire piece that goes into CPU is really plasticky and built with poor quality. So, if I were you, I would be very careful when plugging in the Y-connector. Just like one of the reviewer mentioned, mine also broke. I had to get it replaced right way.
customer_reviews.author: MaSx

customer_reviews.title: What a difference!
customer_reviews.text: bought this for the first time to replace the stock cpu fan and I was amazed at the results. I have the Intel i7 4970k (not OC yet). Before installing this I was getting idle around 40-55c and under load anywhere from 50-70c sometimes peaking to 80c. After installation the idle is now around 25-35c and under load 40-50c. Installation was pretty simple, everything included felt of high quality, you should defiantly get this for better cooling.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Cooling for your CPU
customer_reviews.text: Great cooler - keeps my overclocked cpu running at 40 degrees Celsius at Idle and maxes out at 69 degrees during Benchmark tests. Easy to install and the software is very comprehensive. Will put this in any other computer I build...My I7 4790k cpu is overclocked to 4.8Ghz from 4.00 and the cooler keeps it at steady 40 degrees. I did not use the included fans however, I used Coolermaster Sickle Flow 120 mm Green Fans instead and they are much quieter then the stock fans that come with the kit.
customer_reviews.author: ultra55371d

customer_reviews.title: Powerfull coooler
customer_reviews.text: After one year finally I replace the original cooler for my AMD FX-4170 for this is a excellent cpu cooler. It's an obligation to replace the original fan in H100I for a silent fan if is important the noise for you (  ). This product is a five stars but the original fan are very noisy. I recommend for AMD cpu of more than 2 cores and is very important a special computer case to receive this cooler.
customer_reviews.author: F MB

customer_reviews.title: super cooled if added to the corsair 540
customer_reviews.text: just an awesome thing to add to any computer it's super quiet never hear it even make a cherp the thing keeps my computer super cooled and i hooked up the intake fans to the corsair 540 case to the cpu controller and its running all 4 of the fans really can't get any cooler then this system runs at 34-36 degrees c max now when gaming never seen it get higher and thats from the asus suite which is monitoring the mb temps.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Beckwith

customer_reviews.title: Didn't think I was buying a jet engine. but it works.
customer_reviews.text: Fans are obnoxiously loud. are you seriously selling this with all that noise? It's border line false advertising by omitting in the description that it will wake up your neighbors (that is if you live in an apartment/roommate) jeez im not trying to listen to a jet taking off playing video games. I'm forced to shut it down at night because i can't sleep that it's so loud. replaced with quieter fans and it's ok and managed to OC my processor a whole 1GHz to 4.5 (fx-6300)
customer_reviews.author: Justin Martone

customer_reviews.title: The system works perfectly well. It may get loud ...
customer_reviews.text: The system works perfectly well. It may get loud if the CPU is heating up and it is stable around 32-34 Celsius on my i7 5930k. I have been using it over two months and there is no problem. The only problem I had was that it didn't fit into my phantom 530 as suggested because the instruction suggest to mount the fan on the bottom of the radiator, and the x99s ack motherboard blocks the fan. If your motherboard and case limits your space, be sure to check if there are other ways to mount it or make sure you have other fans you can use.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Quiet once started
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Loaded temps dropped 50+ degrees Quiet once started (PC sits under desk ~3 ft from my ear when sitting) Area around PC feels cooler than ambient room air when under 50% load and about the same otherwise (feel and actual energy state, aka temp, not the same) Cons: Fans rev loudly at start (changing settings in bios didn't fix this) Install in medium case was a hassle (~1 hr with lots of cursing) and directions are NOT super clear
customer_reviews.author: Rich in Classic Flavor

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the 4th Gen i7 cool.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I am a noobie in water cooling so this thing helps greatly. The whole thing ins contained so i dont need to worry about leaks and sit there for hours observing the thing. Just plug and play and you are ready to go. I didn't use the thermal compound it comes with but used the Arctic 5 compound - it works a lot better. The whole thing is customizable - from the fan speed to the LED display of the Corsair logo. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Good AIO cooler
customer_reviews.text: This is my first liquid cooler and I'm happy with the purchase. I can't comment about the noise of the unit. I have 6 other case fans and my case is pretty loud. If you research this product online, you will soon read about the loose backplate. I was concerned about this issue and without reason. My backplate was very loose but when you tighten down the cooler block everything was secure and tight. I have a i7-4790k overclocked to 4.7 currently and the temps are nice and cool.
customer_reviews.author: John Sheridan

customer_reviews.title: Good performance, poor life span
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 6 or 7 months? I might have been the reason it died, as I tried mounting it vertically along the front of my case. It made a gurgling noise and never came back. Before it died, it was amazing. Lots of people have issues with Corsair Link but I found them to be minimal at the worst. CL lets you change the color of the LED and control multiple fans through a simple program. I wish I still had CL with my new set up but I don't.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Super low CPU temps!!
customer_reviews.text: I am running a Intel Core i7 3920 with this cooler. Installation on an LGA2011 board was super easy. Literally took a total of 20 minutes to install. I can't comment as far as installation on the AMD boards or the Intel socket 1150/1155/1156 as I haven't tried it. I Have ran a few benchmarks with this cooler installed and it never allowed the CPU to break 63C. Note though I do not have the CPU overclocked. I am running all stock speeds. It usually idles around 30C or slightly higher. Its a great cooler and would personally recommend it!!
customer_reviews.author: T. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooler! Loud Fans and Crap Software
customer_reviews.text: Works very well! I have been using this to cool my FX-9370 for almost 2 years now and have had no issues! The fans that come with this are fine if you want to go deaf! I replaced the fans with Noctua static pressure fans and they are nice and quiet! I would recommend not even bothering with getting this model as the software sucks and works only half the time for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Have put quite a bit of time on it so far and its working good.. hope it continues
customer_reviews.text: Used this to build a custom direct die setup on both a 3570k and then later an i7 3770k. With going direct die I was able to get 4.933 GHz stable. Have put quite a bit of time on it so far and its working good.. hope it continues. I wasn't able to get the software to work correctly in Windows 8.1 last I tried (been several months). There may be a fix now.. but I'll still give it 5 starts because it pulls a lot of heat out, allowed high overclocks, and so far has been trouble free....
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: GET THIS NOW!
customer_reviews.text: Get that giant radiator out of your case. I was really hesitant to switch to liquid cooling but this was a breeze. It took about 5 minutes to get into my case and after that has been functioning perfectly for about a year. My case is about 100 times more quiet now, its amazing. Get this rather than a big fan and radiator...
customer_reviews.author: Ninjamonkeysd

customer_reviews.title: It was like this for about a week and the hose disconnected ...
customer_reviews.text: I ran the cooler for about a year and a half, though the machine was not on all the time. I had the machine turned off and the power supply was disconnected. It was like this for about a week and the hose disconnected at the CPU cooler and shot the coolant fluid all through my machine. As I said, luckily the power supply was disconnected so I lost no components. I switched to an Noctua air cooled system. I'm overclocking with the same temps as before.
customer_reviews.author: LeakyBucket

customer_reviews.title: my Asus motherboard keeps the RPM down pretty far during normal usage
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my CPU *much* cooler than the stock cooler (I7 3770k). Now I get to overclock it just a bit more. -1 star because the fans are a bit loud. I'll probably wind up replacing them w/ Noctua or some other Corsair SP fan to attempt to quiet it down a bit more. Note: This is only an issue during gaming sessions; my Asus motherboard keeps the RPM down pretty far during normal usage.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy McFadden

customer_reviews.title: - quiet - keeps CPU cool - looks neat - can use cosair software to ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a full tower build. Pros: - quiet - keeps CPU cool - looks neat - can use cosair software to change color of cpu cooler logo cons: - huge radiator. not really a big deal, but took up a lot of space on the top of my desktop - tough install if you are not in a good angle. tubes are tough to move. I liked this product overall, would buy it again for a similar gaming build. Looks great, functions great. Install could of been easier, but im sure my inexperience played a part in this.
customer_reviews.author: tomas

customer_reviews.title: Amd 8320e
customer_reviews.text: Been running this h100i for a week on my 8320e. Haven't over clocked it just yet, but running GTA V 1080p at very high which pushes it to 80% temps are <30c which is amazing (ambient is 24). CorsairLink is required! Otherwise the fans are so damn loud, I set them to quiet ~1000rpm. Pump doesn't make a sound. Make sure to run corsairlink as admin. Install was the easiest.
customer_reviews.author: Terrence

customer_reviews.title: While this version does a great job at cooling
customer_reviews.text: I purposely got this version over the newer version to fit a specific build I had. I have since replaced this version 1 cooler with the second newer version. While this version does a great job at cooling, the version 2 has a thicker, even better cooling radiator.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: This thing works great, my cpu temp as I type this is ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great, my cpu temp as I type this is sitting around 15c which is awesome!! My only complaint is that this thing is LOUD, like SUPER loud..... Gotten used to it after awhile... still contemplating getting new fans for the cooler, but outside of this thing being loud, it works great!!
customer_reviews.author: tykr

customer_reviews.title: 5-Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this CPU Cooler for my son... GREAT PRODUCT! The fans are a little quite loud but we replaced them with some Noctua fans, they are the best. It really brings out the capabilities in this cooler, but he cannot "overclock" because his motherboard is "locked" so I'll be having to buy one where he can get into the "bios".... WHAT A SMART BOY! Planning on buying him more enthusiast/gaming computer parts! As long as he has good grades! Really bang-for-the-buck this cooler is. Thanks Corsair! His previous cooler was extremely loud and didn't offer that much temperature difference, so he loves this!
customer_reviews.author: Rose Guillen

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sealed CPU cooler
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Made by Corsair Liquid cooling without messing with liquid cooling Monitoring application is great Uses a USB header connection so you don't need to buy an adaptor or run a cable out of your case Cons: Pre-applied thermal paste Radiator gets very dusty fairly quick Didn't include an additional 2 fans for a push pull setup This keeps my 3930k nice and cool at 4.0GHz. Never goes above 38C. It is very important to remember that since the radiator has more surface area for cooling, it gathers dust very quickly and should be dusted at least once a month to keep temps down.
customer_reviews.author: Mason Mabardy

customer_reviews.title: Decent cooler but mounting hardware ruins it
customer_reviews.text: I have just returned my second H100i due to faulty mounting hardware. My first one arrived with a bent mounting screw for 1150 mounting. The second one I received was installed in an AMD FX 8350 system. After a week, the pin that holds the cooler to the motherboard snapped. Since they only come with two of these, it rendered the cooler useless. Corsair needs to up the quality control on the mounting kit for these things.
customer_reviews.author: stardewkitteh

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and Reliable Liquid Cooler
customer_reviews.text: After 1 year: Still love it! The liquid cooling is excellent and it keeps my i5-4690k at 25 to 27 degrees idle and 47 to 51 degrees during intensive use. I replaced the fans with the quiet edition corsair fans and it works perfectly as my computer is completely silent when it is idle, browsing the net, watching shows etc.. The white light emitted from the LED indicator looks very clean and is often the first thing an average person compliments when they see my computer. My gamer friends obviously notice the glowing GTX on my 780 first but it goes to show how nice the liquid cooling looks inside my Obsidian 350D
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Initially skeptical, but I'm very happy with liquid cooling for my CPU. Much happier than a huge heat sink, hasn't had a problem yet. Works great, I'll never go back to huge heat sinks sticking up from the motherboard, though they work fine too. Preference.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Galinis

product_meta.title: Corsair Hydro Series Extreme Performance Liquid CPU Cooler H100i
product_meta.description:
Style:Extreme Performance H100iHave a PC case that supports a top-mounted 240mm radiator? Take your CPU cooling to a new level. H100i offers twice the radiator surface area of the H80i for even better performance. Monitor temperature and control lighting and fan speed on your screen. No additional hardware is necessary. The 240mm top-mounted radiator provides maximum surface area for maximum cooling power. The 120mm fans use wide, low-pitch blades for better static pressure to noise ratio, offering improved efficiency at lower noise levels

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


The Hydro Series H100i delivers extreme performance liquid CPU cooling a 240mm top-mounted radiator and Corsair Link monitoring and control.

OVERVIEW
EXTREME PERFORMANCE CPU COOLING
Have a PC case that supports a top-mounted 240mm radiator? Take your CPU cooling to a new level. H100i starts with the advanced design of the Hydro Series H80i, and adds a double-wide radiator for even better performance.

CORSAIR LINK MONITORING AND CONTROL
Monitor temperature and control lighting and fan speed on your screen. No additional hardware is necessary.

FEATURES
SELF-CONTAINED COOLING SYSTEM
Hydro Series H100i comes pre-filled, and never needs refilling or priming.

DUAL RADIATOR WITH CUSTOM FAN DESIGN
The 240mm top-mounted radiator provides maximum surface area for maximum cooling power. The 120mm fans use wide, low-pitch blades for better static pressure to noise ratio, offering improved efficiency at lower noise levels.

BUILT-IN CORSAIR LINK
No additional hardware is necessary – just connect the included Corsair Link cable to a USB header on your motherboard and download the free Corsair Link Dashboard software. You can monitor coolant temperature and adjust cooling performance directly from your desktop.

TOOL-FREE MULTIPLATFORM MAGNETIC MOUNTING BRACKET KIT
The modular design makes installation simpler, and it’s compatible with Intel and AMD processors.

LARGE-DIAMETER, LOW PERMEABILITY TUBING
Minimal coolant evaporation helps ensure long life, and the resilient material offers both high flexibility and excellent leak protection.

CORSAIR HYDRO SERIES LIQUID CPU COOLERS
H40 H55 H60 H70 CORE H80 H80i H100

feature_bullets: Dual length 240mm radiator for increased surface area and cooling potential
Integrated Corsair Link functionality allows you to adjust fan speed profiles and lighting, and monitor coolant temp via the free Corsair Link Dashboard software download
Two SP120L High Performance fans optimize static pressure at a reduced noise level for amazing performance
Large-diameter, low permeability tubing ensures long life and improves flexibility for an easier installation
A new improved micro-channel cold-plate design more efficiently transfers heat
Quick and easy magnetic installation brackets make it easier than ever to upgrade to water-cooling
Includes mounting hardware compatible with all modern CPU socket designs
